term.title: Peierls distortion

item.text: Distortion of a regular one-dimensional structure with a partially occupied band to give bond alternation, eventually leading to dimerization or oligomerization. The degree of oligomerization, λ depends on the electronic population of the conduction band indicated by the wave vector of the Fermi levelkF

notes.item: A Peierls distortion opens a gap at the Fermi level, producing a net stabilization of the distorted structure. The Peierls distortion for chain compounds is analogous to the Jahn–Teller effect for molecules. The prototypical example of the Peierls distortion in organic chemistry is the bond alternation present in polyvinylene. PT07442.png
